page.title: 08EDUCATION IN CURY AREA
page.content: There is one small primary school in the area. The school is in Cury village and consists of one infant class and one junior class. There are 47 children in the school. The school was built in 1967 and resulted in the closure of a small village school in Cury,Gunwalloe and Berepper. Being in the catchment area of Mullion Comprehensive School,children transfer there on reaching their eleventh birthday,staying there until they reach the fifth form. Later transferring to Helston Comprehensive School for sixth form education.Further or higher education being attained at the Camborne Technical College or other Colleges or Universities outside of the County. The nearest being Plymouth. Evening classes for Adult Education are held in Helston and Mullion Comp. Schools.
